titleInfo.title: Letter, J. Crozier Ramsey in Nashville, Tenn., to J.G.M. Ramsey in Charlotte, N.C. 1865 Oct. 8

mods.abstract: 1865 Oct. 8 J.Crozier Ramsey, Nashville, Tenn., to his father, J.G.M. Ramsey, Charlotte, N.C. Relates his trip to Washington, D.C., at which he spoke with President Johnson about their pardons and the hope his case will be postponed until the next session of the court. Warns that Robert should not let his whereabouts be known as he is wanted for murder in Knoxville. Mentions current prices of bank notes, having his photograph made in Washington, and his Uncle William's daughter, Mamie.

subject.topic: Quality of life -- Tennessee -- History -- 19th century.
Family life -- Southern States -- History -- 19th century.
Ramsey, J. Crozier (John Crozier) d. 1868 -- Correspondence.
